content: curl -I https://updates.backdropcms.org/ curl: (60) SSL certificate problem: certificate has expired

Am getting an error searching for a module from within Backdrop Status message Encountered an error when trying to fetch results from Backdrop. Error 0 : Error opening socket ssl://projects.backdropcms.org:443 which might be related?

Hi, Kevin Golding. Welcome to the Backdrop CMS community on Zulip. I'm your friendly neighborhood Dragonbot. Try '@Dragonbot help' for a list of things I can help you with. There are lots of friendly humans that hang around here, so please feel free to ask questions.

Here is a short (3 min) video to help you navigate Zulip. https://youtu.be/DN8YL2MrsSU
@all anyone else having an SSL issue with update server? I haven't checked
I just did a CHECK MANUALLY on /admin/reports/updates from one of my sites and no error for me.

After 2020-05-31 11:00 UTC one site cannot get update information. An example from dblog:
HTTP request to https://updates.backdropcms.org/release-history/bueditor/1.x?site_key=...&version=1.x-2.1&list=bueditor failed with error: Error opening socket ssl://updates.backdropcms.org:443.
Server - Linode Dallas, TX, USA (Debian 8 LTS)

Hm... Can't reproduce a problem here. Neither on command line nor with a real browser.

openssl s_client -connect updates.backdropcms.org:443

The Commodo certificate shows as being valid until 6. October 2020, 23:59:59 GMT

This is only one site running on old but fully updated version of Debian - 8.11. Sites on Debian 9 get update info as usual, but even from such server if I try "curl" - I see same certificate problem report.

I don't have a Debian 8 anymore, the oldest I have is 9 (Stretch). And on a Debian 9 I could reproduce the problem with curl (and only curl). I bet that's rather a curl bug than a problem with Backdrop. On Debian Buster (10) everything works fine.
A quick thought on this: the TLS version? Recent clients (command line or graphical) are using Protocol : TLSv1.3. Maybe the older curl versions aren't aware of this?
Probably this is really kind of problem from old software, but curiously: what changed just yesterday?

There seems to be a problem. I gave ssllabs a try - and that shows the certificate as expired as of yesterday:

https://www.ssllabs.com/ssltest/analyze.html?d=updates.backdropcms.org

Details:
screenshot-expired-cert.png

Are some dev-ops around? Could someone please restart nginx? Some processes still seem to have the old cert loaded.
Related info - https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=23362759
@Nate Lampton or @larsdesigns please see above about old cert

I have the same problem both on shared hosting Jino and on OpenServer. Does it depend on the region? In Russia, we have a lot of sites under the ban in recent years.
Jino-Backdrop-443.JPG OpenServer-Backdrop-443.JPG

Hi, Alexandr. Welcome to the Backdrop CMS community on Zulip. I'm your friendly neighborhood Dragonbot. Try '@Dragonbot help' for a list of things I can help you with. There are lots of friendly humans that hang around here, so please feel free to ask questions.

Here is a short (3 min) video to help you navigate Zulip. https://youtu.be/DN8YL2MrsSU

@Alexandr problem is not specific for a region, if you prefer read on Russian: https://www.opennet.ru/opennews/art.shtml?num=53061

Устаревание корневого сертификата AddTrust привело к массовым сбоям
30 мая истёк 20-летний срок действия корневого сертификата AddTrust , который применялся для формирования перекрёстной подписи (cross-signed) в сертификатах одного из крупнейших удостоверяющих центров Sectigo (Comodo). Перекрёстная подпись позволяла обеспечить совместимость с устаревшими устройствами, в хранилище корневых сертификатов которых не был добавлен новый корневой сертификат USERTRust
@Vladimir thanks for fast reply! I think I get it :)
Hi Folks! Thanks for the heads-up. I'll take a look.

We're affected by https://www.namecheap.com/support/knowledgebase/article.aspx/10228/14/sectigo-root-certificate-expiring-may-30-2020/ While our direct cert has not yet expired, the root certificate that qualifies ours expired yesterday. Weird that would happen at all. I'll reissue the cert
Root certificates are fixed with updated versions . Increased our cipher security as well so we're now A rated. Thanks @Vladimir for raising this issue! image.png
